Reviews.Title: “Not the best, but could be worse....”
Reviews.Author: dsion_cardiff
Reviews.Content: Having recently stayed at the Terni, we thought we'd let you know what we thought. It's a very central hotel, so for that it gets a big plus. However, there were many negative points to the hotel, which meant 2 stars only. Firstly, AIR CON! There is none at the hotel. The first night was so hot, we didn't get any sleep which we thought would ruin our stay. However, we did manage to get a little used to this, although it did mean around 4 showers a day. They have a fan (old fashioned one on the roof - noisy) but it's nothing like air con. Secondly, the room and the whole hotel could do with a little updating! The wall paper was a little torn and also faded. Thirdly, there was quite a bit of noise coming from other rooms. On one night, we were woken up by a group of teenagers at around 3am slamming doors and shouting, and this went on for a good hour or so. Also, we had a dog in the room next door (although this didn't bother us, we could hear him yapping every now and then). Lastly, security! Or lack of! We arrived back in the room around mid-day and found our room door wide open. We went in expecting to see the maid, but there was no sign of anyone. After 5 minutes of checking out stuff, we realised the gate (to the outside, not a balcony but a little flower pot area) was open and the maid was out there who seemed shocked to see us. How long the door was open for I don't know. Also, we had a fair bit of money with us and there was no option for a safe or security box at the hotel. A plus (in my opinion) is the lift! Yes it's about as old as the Colosseum, but it's brilliant! I loved it anyway! As we said, it's a good location for anyone, very close to the Termini Station, athough we did walk everywhere. We did all the usual visits and sightseeing and it's all very easy from the hotel. There's also plenty of food places within 5 minutes of the hotel. I hope this helps, if anyone has any questions, please feel free to contact me. Cheers, Rach & Daf

Reviews.Title: “Very close to Rome Central station (Termini)”
Reviews.Author: Canada_TimeTraveller
Reviews.Content: My friend & I stayed one night here in June 2011. The hotel is about 2-3 minutes walk from Rome Termini station (which I think is their best asset!). We took a room with shared washroom (the room has a sink though). Washroom is very very small. The shower area is only about 2 ft x 4 ft. Absolutely, no big fat person can fit it in. The room doesn’t have air conditioner, just a small desk fan. There’s a small TV in the room with only 1 English channel. The hotel is kinda difficult to find since there are lots of one way streets in the neighbourhood. It is situated on top of a pasta & pizza restaurant and the room we got was facing the street. We didn’t get quality sleep on our first night in Rome as all we could hear was the noise from the people eating at the restaurant, cars passing by, the screeching sound of the streetcar on the rails, and the sound of tables & chairs being stacked when the restaurant closes at past midnight. The hotel is generally kept clean. There’s an old-type elevator that only 2 people with small luggages can fit in (see attached pictures). The male receptionist only provided answers to questions we specifically asked, and gave us a map. There was no effort to give us more details about the neighbourhood, the public transportation, good restaurants, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfy, great quality for the price”
Reviews.Author: thelynne
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our spring break. For what we paid, we could not complain much. The room was small but clean and comfortable... we loved that we had TV with the BBC news, a clean bathroom that we never had to wait for, even though we shared it with the floor... and the location, which is very convenient for the train station and the main sites. The noise comments are true but we were tired enough not to notice. Double bed is actually two singles stuck together, but whatever. Staff is willing to explain to you which metro stops you should take for certain monuments. Small problem. When we invited a friend to spend an evening in our room, the hotel staff got pissy and forbade him from being there. It was annoying. As long as the prices stay the same-- we were at about 40 euro per night, split between two-- I highly recommend this hotel for anyone on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Decent value, very close to the train station”
Reviews.Author: JasonManikel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights at the beginning of a two-week trip in Italy. (We were in seven different hotels on the trip, so have many to compare to.) As other reviews suggest, the best thing about this place is the great, convenient location. Other than that, nothing very special. Reasonably clean, reasonably friendly and helpful staff (most of whom speak decent English). It was pretty noisy outside, but we were very close to the station, and I'm not sure we could have found quieter this close. The setup is a bit confusing, with Terni sharing a single reception and lobby on the second ("first") floor with another sister hotel "Dina". As elsewhere in Italy, the queen bed is really just two twin mattresses side-by-side on a single frame. Probably no way to get a queen mattress up into the building. Breakfast didn't look like a good value and we opted out.

Reviews.Title: “Eh”
Reviews.Author: IntrepidFromDC
Reviews.Content: The bathroom was not very clean. The toilet lid was held to the toilet by one screw. The elevator is Roman for sure - ancient Roman! But - we only had two nights in Rome before flying home from Fiumcino, and we tend to leave the hotel at 8am and sightsee all day until midnight, so since the location was great to catch the Leonardo Express to Fiumcino, I gave it three radio buttons instead of two. There are many hotels near the train station, so I would take my chances somewhere else next time. We have been very happy with the generally reliable reviews on hotels on TA, this is the only exception. Price was highest of any city we stayed in (including Venice) and room was the dirtiest. If you are not a person who prays, try the elevator and see if that doesn't help.

Reviews.Title: “Few steps away from Termini, good rooms”
Reviews.Author: manilagirl83
Reviews.Content: The hotel has an excellent location, perfect for tourists, a few steps from Termini station, from which you can easily get a bus or metro or train to/from FCO or CIA airports. Its also very near many churches. The rooms are also good value for money, clean and not too big. The hotel has an old-fashioned lift, which worked fine and adds a bit of charm I think.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: PiterHa
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a good location though it is not clean at all I could not even stay to try the breakfast!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good price, simple but clean"”
Reviews.Author: Aneli32
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Termi for 3 nights, 2 once we arrived to Rome and 1 on our way back. The best thing about this hotel is its location. Less than 2 blocks from the main train terminal in Rome (this is the one you arrive from the Airport and leave to other cities from) which is also where the local subway is located. This subway takes you everywhere in the center of Rome including the Vatican, Spanish Steps, Fountain of Trevi, the Colosseum, etc. Of course you will always have to walk a little from the station to destination but riding the subway is an inexpensive way to get you really close. Also this terminal is in the middle between routs A and B of the subway. It is the best terminal if you ask me, so it would be good to stay near it. Now about the rooms, as I said they are very simple but clean. We stayed in a double room 112, in winter time. The heater worked well and there was plenty of hot water in the shower. It has a hair dryer, shampoo, soap, and all those basic things. In general the bathroom is small but efficient. The reception spoke English, The price was very competitive for the location so I found this place to be a good option. I would stay here again if traveling in a budget. Ahh... breakfast is not included.

Reviews.Title: “best for using public conveyance , close to all attractions”
Reviews.Author: cmukho
Reviews.Content: This rome hotel we selected for its proximity to roma termini.All the historical sites are easily accessible.the room is spacious and clean.though it was B&b the breakfast is missing. but there are many eathouses in proximity. we used tram and buses to roam around .

Reviews.Title: “Cosy hotel, good location, cleanliness and price!”
Reviews.Author: Yellow_moonkey
Reviews.Content: great location, very nice and clean room, clean bathroom, normal staff, not very communicative and smiling but ok.quite. (We stayed there last August 2009, not 2010)

Reviews.Title: “Didn't expect much for €50 a night”
Reviews.Author: pacard
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for one night before going to florence. The room was adequate with an ensuite bathroom. Our room overlooked the tramway and was veru noisy even with the windows closed so we didn't get much sleep. Check in took ages since there was only one person at the reception and he seemed to be incharge of 4 other hotels (since the hotel is in a block with about 4 other hotels). However, for 50€ a night we didn't expect much better except for soundproof rooms maybe!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, great location. Would defintely stay again.”
Reviews.Author: Adam93
Reviews.Content: Very impressed with quality and locaton of hotel considering the cheap price. Spot on location next to the station, not too noisy, but while i stayed the hotel across the road was being rennovated so was a little noisy sometimes, but these things cant be helped. Got an upgraded room / en-suite free of charge! Friendly hotel staff, they were helpful and we found the hotel maps of Rome to be the most useful! Situated on nice street with a nice amount of restaurants all the way along, so was never short for somewhere nice to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Very good price/quality relationship”
Reviews.Author: Moscowtravel
Reviews.Content: Overall stay in the hotel was good. Friendly personnel, good service. Good location for sightseeing. Relationship between price/quality was very good. I have paid only 30 euros per a day! As for Rome. It was not so good. There is a lot of swindlers and robbers in the Rome streets, who aspire to deceive foreigners, especially to take away their money. It is necessary to avoid contact with casual passers-by. Moreover it is necessary to avoid private taxi (without taxi signs), especially near Termini railway station. Actually drivers in the private taxi are swindlers and robbers.

Reviews.Title: “* No AC (air conditioning) in single rooms”
Reviews.Author: Bruce35dc
Reviews.Content: Warning - do not stay here in summer if you are solo\single. Single rooms have no air conditioning. To compare against similar hotel - July 21, I stayed 2 days at Hotel Halifax in Rome (north of Central Station) in large room with AC, and shower for 45 euros per night. Halifax has no elevator but otherwise was good place. Booked Terni a week later for 40 euros a night. Terni as close as Halifax just opposite (south) side of Central Station. Terni room much smaller. Room had bath and good shower but NO AC!! Just an overhead fan. Had to keep window open and heard alley noise all night long. Also people slamming heavy doors. Slept with wet towel to keep cool. Told manager about room at Halifax and that I would pay another 5 to 10 euros to get AC, but he said rooms with AC are 70 euros or more.

Reviews.Title: “Is this a joke?”
Reviews.Author: aycarayhuatulco
Reviews.Content: Our room did not resemble any of the rooms in the photos.- peeling yellowing wallpaper, horrible lighting, a shower head that sprays only the wall, furniture from 1967, a blowdrier that my grandmother may have used. There is cheap and quaint and then there is neglected and in disrepair which Hotel Terni was.. Despite amiable staff and a superb location, I could not reccommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Stranger_Denmark
Reviews.Content: Great location and warm and friendly staff. They were very helpful with trying to contact the airline Alitalia about our lost luggage. We stayed in a "basic room" and it was comfortable. And the bathroom was exactly what the hotel website says: "ancient bathroom with shower without curtain and without box". :-) The location was perfect--literally two minutes from Rome's main train station. I doubt you can find anything better for this price in the center of Rome. We would stay here again.
